description: The Observation Request (OBR) segment is used to transmit information specific to an order for a diagnostic study or observation, physical exam, or assessment.

fields.name: Set ID - OBR
fields.description: For the first order transmitted, the sequence number shall be 1; for the second order, it shall be 2; and so on.

fields.name: Placer Order Number
fields.description: This field is identical to ORC-2-Placer Order Number.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Filler Order Number
fields.description: This field is the order number associated with the filling application. This is a permanent identifier for an order and its associated observations. It is a special case of the Entity Identifier data type (see Chapter 2, Section 2.A.28, "EI - entity identifier").

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Universal Service Identifier
fields.description: This field contains the identifier code for the requested observation/test/battery. This can be based on local and/or "universal" codes. We recommend the "universal" procedure identifier. The structure of this CE data type is described in the control section.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Priority - OBR
fields.description: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only . It is not used. Previously priority (e.g., STAT, ASAP), but this information is carried as the sixth component of OBR-27-quantity/timing.

fields.name: Requested Date/Time
fields.description: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only . It is not used. Previously requested date/time. This information is now carried in the fourth component of the OBR-27-quantity/timing.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Observation Date/Time
fields.description: This field is the clinically relevant date/time of the observation. In the case of observations taken directly from a subject, it is the actual date and time the observation was obtained. In the case of a specimen-associated study, this field shall represent the date and time the specimen was collected or obtained. (This is a results-only field except when the placer or a third party has already drawn the specimen.) This field is conditionally required. When the OBR is transmitted as part of a report message, the field must be filled in. If it is transmitted as part of a request and a sample has been sent along as part of the request, this field must be filled in because this specimen time is the physiologically relevant date/time of the observation.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Observation End Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the end date and time of a study or timed specimen collection. If an observation takes place over a substantial period of time, it will indicate when the observation period ended. For observations made at a point in time, it will be null. This is a results field except when the placer or a party other than the filler has already drawn the specimen.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Collection Volume
fields.description: For laboratory tests, the collection volume is the volume of a specimen. The default unit is ML. Specifically, units should be expressed in the ISO Standard unit abbreviations (ISO-2955, 1977). This is a results-only field except when the placer or a party has already drawn the specimen.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: This component specifies the numeric quantity or amount of an entity.

fields.name: Units
fields.description: This component species the units in which the quantity is expressed. Field-by-field, default units may be defined within the specifications. When the quantity is measured in the default units, the units need not be transmitted. If the quantity is recorded in units different from the default, the units must be transmitted.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Collector Identifier
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons
fields.description: When a specimen is required for the study, this field will identify the person, department, or facility that collected the specimen. Either name or ID code, or both, may be present.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, " FN - family name".

fields.name: Surname
fields.description: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.description: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.description: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix (e.g., Jr Or Iii)
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix (e.g., Dr)
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree (e.g., Md)
fields.description: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency of department) that creates the data. User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values. See Section 2.A.88.7, " Name Type Code (ID) ".

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.description: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.description:
Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to XCN.19 Effective Date and XCN.20 Expiration Date instead. This component cannot be fully expressed and has been identified as v 2.4 erratum.

This component contains the start and end date/times that define the period during which this name was valid. See section 2.A.20, " DR - date/time range " for description of subcomponents.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the TS (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.description: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 Table 0444 - Name Assembly Order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.description: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 1-3. It belongs conceptually to the group of component 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 4-6. It belongs conceptually to the group of alternate components (See usage note in section introduction) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text

fields.name: Specimen Action Code
fields.description: This field identifies the action to be taken with respect to the specimens that accompany or precede this order. The purpose of this field is to further qualify (when appropriate) the general action indicated by the order control code contained in the accompanying ORC segment. For example, when a new order (ORC - "NW") is sent to the lab, this field would be used to tell the lab whether or not to collect the specimen ("L" or "O"). Refer to HL7 Table 0065 - Specimen Action Code for valid values.

fields.name: Danger Code
fields.description: This field contains the code and/or text indicating any known or suspected patient or specimen hazards, e.g., patient with active tuberculosis or blood from a hepatitis patient. Either code and/or text may be absent. However, the code is always placed in the first component position and any free text in the second component. Thus, free text without a code must be preceded by a component delimiter.

fields.name: Relevant Clinical Information
fields.description: This field contains the additional clinical information about the patient or specimen. This field is used to report the suspected diagnosis and clinical findings on requests for interpreted diagnostic studies. Examples include reporting the amount of inspired carbon dioxide for blood gasses, the point in the menstrual cycle for cervical pap tests, and other conditions that influence test interpretations. For some orders this information may be sent on a more structured form as a series of OBX segments that immediately follow the order segment.

fields.name: Ordering Provider
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons
fields.description: This field identifies the provider who ordered the test. Either the ID code or the name, or both, may be present. This is the same as ORC-12-ordering provider.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, " FN - family name".

fields.name: Surname
fields.description: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.description: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.description: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix (e.g., Jr Or Iii)
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix (e.g., Dr)
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree (e.g., Md)
fields.description: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency of department) that creates the data. User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values. See Section 2.A.88.7, " Name Type Code (ID) ".

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.description: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.description:
Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to XCN.19 Effective Date and XCN.20 Expiration Date instead. This component cannot be fully expressed and has been identified as v 2.4 erratum.

This component contains the start and end date/times that define the period during which this name was valid. See section 2.A.20, " DR - date/time range " for description of subcomponents.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the TS (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.description: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 Table 0444 - Name Assembly Order for valid values.

fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Order Callback Phone Number
fields.description: This field contains the telephone number for reporting a status or a result using the standard format with extension and/or beeper number when applicable.

fields.name: Telephone Number
fields.description:
This component has been retained for backward compatibility only as of version 2.3. 

Specifies the telephone number in a predetermined format that includes an optional extension, beeper number and comment.

fields.name: Telecommunication Use Code
fields.description: A code that represents a specific use of a telecommunicationnumber. Refer to HL7 Table 0201 - Telecommunication use code for valid values.

fields.name: Telecommunication Equipment Type
fields.description: A code that represents the type of telecommunicationequipment. Refer to HL7 Table 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Extension
fields.description: Contains comments with respect to the telephone number.

fields.name: Any Text
fields.description: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system network used as a prefix to the Extension component for internal dialing. Note that the use of Extension Prefix requires that the Extension component be valued and that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Extension Prefix
fields.description: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system used in place of the (external) telephone number to facilitate calling because its length is shorter than that of the telephone number. Note that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Speed Dial Code
fields.description: An expression of the telephone number as an unparsible string.

fields.name: Unformatted Telephone Number
fields.description:
An expression of the telephone number as an unparsible string

Example: |^^^^^^^^^^^1-800-Dentist|

fields.name: Placer Field 1
fields.description: This field is user field #1. Text sent by the placer will be returned with the results.

fields.name: Placer Field 2
fields.description: This field is similar to placer field #1.

fields.name: Filler Field 1
fields.description: This field is definable for any use by the filler (diagnostic service).

fields.name: Filler Field 2
fields.description: This field is similar to filler field #1.

fields.name: Results Rpt/Status Chng - Date/Time
fields.description: This field specifies the date/time when the results were reported or status changed. This field is used to indicate the date and time that the results are composed into a report and released, or that a status, as defined in ORC-5 order status, is entered or changed. (This is a results field only.) When other applications (such as office or clinical database applications) query the laboratory application for untransmitted results, the information in this field may be used to control processing on the communications link. Usually, the ordering service would want only those results for which the reporting date/time is greater than the date/time the inquiring application last received results.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Charge to Practice
fields.description: This field is the charge to the ordering entity for the studies performed when applicable. The first component is a dollar amount when known by the filler. The second is a charge code when known by the filler (results only).

fields.name: Monetary Amount
fields.description: The code identifying the charge to the ordering entity for the services performed.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The first component is a quantity.

fields.name: Denomination
fields.description: The second component is the denomination in which the quantity is expressed. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, MSH-17-country code is used to determine the default.

fields.name: Text

fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Diagnostic Serv Sect ID
fields.description: This field is the section of the diagnostic service where the observation was performed. If the study was performed by an outside service, the identification of that service should be recorded here. Refer to HL7 Table 0074 - Diagnostic Service Section ID for valid entries.

fields.name: Result Status
fields.description: This field contains the status of results for this order. This conditional field is required whenever the OBR is contained in a report message. It is not required as part of an initial order.

fields.name: Parent Result
fields.description: This field is defined to make it available for other types of linkages (e.g., toxicology). This important information, together with the information in OBR-29-parent, uniquely identifies the parent result's OBX segment related to this order. The value of this OBX segment in the parent result is the organism or chemical species about which this battery reports. For example, if the current battery is an antimicrobial susceptibility, the parent results identified OBX contains a result which identifies the organism on which the susceptibility was run. This indirect linkage is preferred because the name of the organism in the parent result may undergo several preliminary values prior to finalization.

fields.name: Parent Observation Identifier
fields.description: Contains the unique identifier of the parent observation as defined in the OBX-3 of the parent result. The value is the same as the OBX-3 of the parent.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Parent Observation Sub-identifier
fields.description: Contains the sub-ID of the parent result as defined in the OBX-4 of the parent result. The value is the same as the OBX-4 of the parent.

fields.name: Parent Observation Value Descriptor
fields.description: Contains a descriptor of the parent observation value as specified in the OBX-5 of the parent result.

fields.name: Quantity/Timing
fields.description: This field is retained for backward compatibility only. The reader is referred to the TQ1 and TQ2 segments.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: This component specifies the quantity of the service that should be provided at each service interval. For example, if two blood cultures are to be obtained every 4 hours, the quantity would be 2. If three units of blood are to be typed and cross-matched, the quantity would be 3. The default value is 1. When units are required, they can be added, specified by a subcomponent delimiter.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: This component specifies the numeric quantity or amount of an entity.

fields.name: Units
fields.description: This component species the units in which the quantity is expressed. Field-by-field, default units may be defined within the specifications. When the quantity is measured in the default units, the units need not be transmitted. If the quantity is recorded in units different from the default, the units must be transmitted.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Interval
fields.description: Determines the interval between repeated services.

fields.name: Repeat Pattern
fields.description: The repeating frequency with which the treatment is to be administered. It is similar to the frequency and SIG code tables used in order entry systems.

fields.name: Explicit Time Interval
fields.description: This component explicitly lists the actual times referenced by the code in the first component, in the following format: HHMM,HHMM,HHMM,. This second component will be used to clarify the first component in cases where the actual times vary within an institution. If the time of the order spans more than a single day, this new component is only practical if the same times of administration occur for each day of the order. If the actual start time of the order (as given by the fourth component of the quantity/timing field) is after the first explicit time, the first administration is taken to be the first explicit time after the start time. In the case where the patient moves to a location having a different set of explicit times, the existing order may be updated with a new quantity/timing field showing the changed explicit times.

fields.name: Duration
fields.description: This component indicates how long the service should continue after it is started. The default is INDEF (do indefinitely). This component is coded as follows:

fields.name: Start Date/Time
fields.description: This component may be specified by the orderer, in which case it indicates the earliest date/time at which the services should be started. In many cases, however, the start date/time will be implied or will be defined by other fields in the order record (e.g., urgency - STAT). In such a case, this field will be empty.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: End Date/Time
fields.description: When filled in by the requester of the service, this component should contain the latest date/time that the service should be performed. If it has not been performed by the specified time, it should not be performed at all. The requester may not always fill in this value, yet the filling service may fill it in on the basis of the instruction it receives and the actual start time.

fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Priority
fields.description: This component describes the urgency of the request. The following values are suggested (the default for Priority is R):

fields.name: Condition
fields.description: This is a free text component that describes the conditions under which the drug is to be given. For example, PRN pain , or to keep blood pressure below 110. The presence of text in this field should be taken to mean that human review is needed to determine the how and/or when this drug should be given.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: This component is a full text version of the instruction (optional).

fields.name: Conjunction
fields.description: This non-null component indicates that a second timing specification is to follow using the repeat delimiter. Refer to HL7 table 0472 - TQ Conjunction ID for valid values

fields.name: Sequence/Results Flag
fields.description: Identifies whether sequence conditions or a repeating cycle of orders is defined. Refer to HL7-defined Table 0524 - Sequence condition for valid values.

fields.name: Placer Order Number: Entity Identifier
fields.description: Contains the first component of the placer order number, entity identifier .

fields.name: Placer Order Number: Namespace Id
fields.description: Contains the second component of the placer order number, namespace ID. Refer to user-defined table 0363 - Assigning Authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Filler Order Number: Entity Identifier
fields.description: Contains the first component of the filler order number, entity identifier.

fields.name: Filler Order Number: Namespace Id
fields.description: Contains the second component of the filler order number, namespace ID. Refer to user-defined table 0363 - Assigning Authority for suggested values

fields.name: Sequence Condition Value
fields.description: Defines the relationship between the start/end of the related predecessor or successor order and the current order from ORC-2, 3 or 4.

fields.name: Maximum Number Of Repeats
fields.description: The maximum number of repeats to be used only on cyclic groups. The total number of repeats is constrained by the end date/time of the last repeat or the end date/time of the parent, whichever is first.

fields.name: Placer Order Number: Universal Id
fields.description: Contains the next to the last component of the placer order number, universal ID.

fields.name: Placer Order Number: Universal Id Type
fields.description: Contains the last component of the placer order number. Refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID Type for valid values.

fields.name: Filler Order Number: Universal Id
fields.description: Contains the next to the last component of the filler order number, universal ID.

fields.name: Filler Order Number: Universal Id Type
fields.description: Contains the last component of the placer order number. Refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID Type for valid values.

fields.name: Occurrence Duration
fields.description: This component contains the duration for a single performance of a service, e.g., whirlpool twenty minutes three times per day for three days. It is optional within TQ and does not repeat.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Total Occurrences
fields.description: This component contains the total number of occurrences of a service that should result from this order. It is optional within TQ and does not repeat. If both the end date/time and the total occurrences are valued and the occurrences would extend beyond the end date/time, then the end date/time takes precedence. Otherwise the number of occurrences takes precedence.

fields.name: Result Copies To
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons
fields.description: This field identifies the people who are to receive copies of the results. By local convention, either the ID number or the name may be absent.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, " FN - family name".

fields.name: Surname
fields.description: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.description: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.description: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix (e.g., Jr Or Iii)
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix (e.g., Dr)
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree (e.g., Md)
fields.description: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency of department) that creates the data. User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values. See Section 2.A.88.7, " Name Type Code (ID) ".

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.description: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.description:
Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to XCN.19 Effective Date and XCN.20 Expiration Date instead. This component cannot be fully expressed and has been identified as v 2.4 erratum.

This component contains the start and end date/times that define the period during which this name was valid. See section 2.A.20, " DR - date/time range " for description of subcomponents.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the TS (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.description: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 Table 0444 - Name Assembly Order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.description: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 1-3. It belongs conceptually to the group of component 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 4-6. It belongs conceptually to the group of alternate components (See usage note in section introduction) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Assigning Agency Or Department
fields.description: The agency or department that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id

fields.name: Original Text

fields.name: Parent
fields.description: This field is identical to ORC-8-parent. This field relates a child to its parent when a parent-child relationship exists. For example, observations that are spawned by previous observations, e.g., antimicrobial susceptibilities spawned by blood cultures, need to record the parent (blood culture) filler order number here. The parent-child mechanism is described under the order control field notes. It is required when the order is a child.

fields.name: Placer Assigned Identifier
fields.description: Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by the placer system.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Filler Assigned Identifier
fields.description: Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by the filler system.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Transportation Mode
fields.description: This field identifies how (or whether) to transport a patient, when applicable. Refer to HL7 Table 0124 - Transportation Mode for valid codes.

fields.name: Reason for Study
fields.description: This field is the code or text using the conventions for coded fields. This is required for some studies to obtain proper reimbursement.

fields.name: Principal Result Interpreter
fields.description: This field identifies the physician or other clinician who interpreted the observation and is responsible for the report content.

fields.dataTypeName: Composite ID Number and Name Simplified
fields.description: This component specifies the name of the person performing a service.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: Coded ID according to a user-defined table. If the first component is present, either component 8 or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component contains the person's family name in a string format.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: Used to specify a first name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to User-defined Table 0360 - Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: Refer to User-defined Table 0297 - CN ID source for suggested values. Used to delineate the first component. If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.description:
Assigning Authority is normally expressed as an HD data type, but has been flattened to 3 components here (CNS.9, CNS.10 and CNS.11) in this data type so that it may be fully expressed. Also note that if additional components are added to the HD data type in the future, adjustment will need to be made accordingly to this data type. 

If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Assigning Authority- Universal Id
fields.description: If CNN.11 is valued, this component must be valued. If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

If this component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values.

If CNN.10 is valued, this component must be valued. If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Point Of Care
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the point where patient care is administered. It is conditional on NDL. 9 Person Location Type (e.g., nursing unit or department or clinic). After floor, it is the most general patient location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0302 - Point of care for suggested values

fields.name: Room
fields.description: Patient room. After point of care, it is the most general location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0303 - Room for suggested values.

fields.name: Bed
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the patient's bed. After room, it is the most general location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0304 - Bed for suggested values.

fields.name: Facility
fields.description: This component is subject to site interpretation but generally describes the highest level physical designation of an institution, medical center or enterprise. It is the most general location designation.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Location Status
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the status or availability of the location. For example, it may convey bed status. Refer to User-defined Table 0306 - Location status for suggested values.

fields.name: Patient Location Type
fields.description: Location type is the categorization of the location defined by facility, building, floor, point of care, room or bed. Although not a required field, when used, it may be the only populated field. Usually includes values such as nursing unit, department, clinic, SNF, physicians office. Refer to User-defined Table 0305 - Person location type for suggested values.

fields.name: Building
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the building where the person is located. After facility, it is the most general location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0307 - Building for suggested values.

fields.name: Floor
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the floor where the person is located. After building, it is the most general location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0308 - Floor for suggested values.

fields.name: Number of Sample Containers
fields.description: This field identifies the number of containers for a given sample. For sample receipt verification purposes; may be different from the total number of samples which accompany the order.

fields.name: Transport Logistics of Collected Sample
fields.description: This field is the means by which a sample reaches the diagnostic service provider. This information is to aid the lab in scheduling or interpretation of results. Possible answers: routine transport van, public postal service, etc. If coded, requires a user-defined table.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Collector's Comment
fields.description: This field is for reporting additional comments related to the sample. If coded, requires a user-defined table. If only free text is reported, it is placed in the second component with a null in the first component, e.g., ^difficult clotting after venipuncture and ecchymosis .

fields.name: Procedure Code Modifier
fields.description: This field contains the procedure code modifier to the procedure code reported in OBR-44-procedure code, when applicable. Procedure code modifiers are defined by regulatory agencies such as CMS and the AMA. Multiple modifiers may be reported. The modifiers are sequenced in priority according to user entry. In the USA, this is a requirement of the UB and the 1500 claim forms. Multiple modifiers are allowed and the order placed on the form affects reimbursement . Refer to user-defined table 0340 - Procedure code modifier for suggested values.

Typically it will reflect the same information as was sent to the filler system in OBR-46-Placer supplemental information unless the order was modified in which case the filler system will report what was actually performed using this field. fields.name: Medically Necessary Duplicate Procedure Reason.
fields.description: This field is used to document why the procedure found in OBR-44 - Procedure Code is a duplicate of one ordered/charged previously for the same patient within the same date of service and has been determined to be medically necessary. The reason may be coded or it may be a free text entry.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 1-3. It belongs conceptually to the group of component 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 4-6. It belongs conceptually to the group of alternate components (See usage note in section introduction) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Result Handling
fields.description: Transmits information regarding the handling of the result. For example, an order may specify that the result (e.g., an x-ray film) should be given to the patient for return to the requestor. Refer to User-defined Table 0507 Observation Result Handling for suggested values. If this field is not populated then routine handling is implied.
